translated: There is little hope that they are alive.

original: Qui va payer pour ça ?
translated: Who's going to pay for this?

original: Chers amis ! Je vous remercie d'être venus malgré ce temps épouvantable.
translated: Dear friends! I thank you for coming in spite of the ghastly weather.

original: Bonjour.
translated: Good afternoon.

original: Nous associons l'Égypte au Nil.
translated: We associate Egypt with the Nile.

original: Je ne le réessayerais pas.
translated: I wouldn't try that again.

original: Où êtes-vous donc ?
translated: Where are you, then?

original: Cette poule n'a pas pondu d'œufs récemment.
translated: This hen hasn't laid any eggs recently.

original: Son mari est riche.
translated: His husband is rich.

original: Je crois cet homme perdu.
translated: I believe this man is lost.

original: Heureusement, j'ai la main verte.
translated: Fortunately, I have a green thumb.

original: J'étais sur le point de quitter la maison quand le téléphone sonna.
translated: I was just about to leave the house when the telephone rang.

original: J’ai mangé mon père.
translated: I ate my father.

original: Achetez la version complète.
translated: Buy the full version.

original: La route a été fermée en raison du brouillard.
translated: The road was closed due to the fog.

original: Je crois en Jésus-Christ.
translated: I believe in Jesus Christ.

original: Je suppose que c'est ainsi que je le ferais.
translated: I guess that's how I'd do it.

original: On ne peut abuser que de choses qui sont bonnes.
translated: We can only abuse of things that are good.

original: Susan cassa le plat exprès pour montrer sa colère.
translated: Susan broke the dish on purpose to show her anger.

original: Je suis incroyablement occupé.
translated: I'm incredibly busy.

original: Elle l'adore.
translated: She adores him.

original: Les bonnes choses arrivent à ceux qui savent faire preuve de patience.
translated: All good things come to those who wait.

original: Vous êtes le sel de la terre.
translated: You are the salt of the earth.

original: Désolé, je ne crois pas que je puisse le faire.
translated: Sorry, I don't think I can do it.

original: Quelle remarquable interprétation !
translated: What a remarkable performance!

original: Il est bon au basketball.
translated: He is good at basketball.

original: J'aime ta robe.
translated: I like your dress.

original: Ce fut une erreur.
translated: This was a mistake.

original: Vous n'écoutez pas, n'est-ce pas ?
translated: You're not listening, are you?

original: J'y ai pris beaucoup plaisir.
translated: I enjoyed it very much.

original: Tes chaussures ne vont pas avec ce vêtement.
translated: Your shoes do not go with the suit.

original: En vérité, je me suis fait gronder par ma mère.
translated: To tell the truth, I was scolded by my mother.

original: Il garda son énergie pour le prochain match.
translated: He conserved his energy for the next game.

original: Je ne me sens vraiment pas bien.
translated: I really don't feel well.

original: Deux promeneurs se sont perdus dans la forêt. Quand les sauveteurs les ont retrouvés quelques semaines plus tard, ils n'avaient que la peau sur les os.
translated: Two hikers got lost in the woods. When rescuers found them weeks later, they were all skin and bones.

original: J'ai déchiré mon pantalon.
translated: I ripped my pants.

original: C'est une histoire très divertissante.
translated: This is a very entertaining story.

original: Je recherche un boulot bien payé.
translated: I'm looking for a job that pays well.

original: J'ai vu le film.
translated: I watched the movie.

original: Il a une grande famille.
translated: He's got a large family.

original: Personne de la famille de Tom n'était présent au mariage.
translated: No one from Tom's family attended the wedding.

original: Tom se découragea.
translated: Tom became discouraged.

original: As-tu appelé ?
translated: Did you call?

original: Je ne parle aucune langue étrangère.
translated: I don't speak any foreign languages.

original: Mon père a une ferme et il élève des bœufs et des chevaux.
translated: My father has a ranch and breeds cattle and horses.

original: Le rire peut tuer.
translated: Laughter can kill.

original: Le bien-être du paysan est vital pour celui de toute la nation.
translated: The welfare of the farmer is vital to that of the whole country.

original: Dois-je me déshabiller ?
translated: Do I have to undress?

original: Est-ce que quelqu'un peut me l'expliquer en détail ?
translated: Can someone explain it to me in detail?

original: Que ferais Tom si jamais il apprenait la vérité.
translated: What would Tom do if he ever learned the truth?

original: Tom et Marie ont dit qu'ils s'étaient trompés.
translated: Tom and Mary said they were mistaken.

original: Ce vampire travaille pour une banque du sang.
translated: This vampire works for a blood bank.

original: Je ne veux pas y aller. Il ne veut pas non plus.
translated: I don't want to go there. He doesn't want to go either.

original: C'est l'Edison du Japon.
translated: He is the Edison of Japan.

original: Les châteaux sont, en majeure partie, entourés par des douves.
translated: Most castles have a moat surrounding them.

original: Qu'allons-nous faire aujourd'hui ?
translated: What are we going to do today?

original: Voyons voir ce que tu as dans ta valise.
translated: Let's see what you've got in your suitcase.

original: Il a acheté un chapeau.
translated: He bought a hat.

original: Viens dehors.
translated: Come outside.

original: Il faut que je porte des bottes.
translated: I have to wear boots.

original: Je n'en ai pris conscience qu'à ce moment-là.
translated: I realized it only then.

original: Je suis étudiant.
translated: I'm a university student.

original: L'immigrant a avoué son crime.
translated: The immigrant confesses his crime.

original: Fais vite, Tom.
translated: Hurry up, Tom.

original: Un tableau orne le mur.
translated: A painting adorns the wall.

original: Elle est issue de pur sang bleu, voyez-vous. Malheureusement, ce n'est pas une sorte d'accoutrement, mais sa véritable nature.
translated: She's pure bred blue-blood you see. Unfortunately that's no sort of put-on but her natural self.

original: Elle prend toujours son temps pour choisir sa robe.
translated: She always takes her time in choosing her dress.

original: Combien la musique est-elle importante dans ta vie ?
translated: How important is music in your life?

original: Elle a tapé du poing sur la table.
translated: She thumped the table with her fist.

original: Les nourrissons attrapent facilement des maladies.
translated: Infants are subject to diseases.

original: Lis le chapitre 4 pour vendredi.
translated: Read chapter 4 for Friday.

original: Il baissa la voix.
translated: He dropped his voice.

original: Je ne comprends pas ce que tu veux dire.
translated: I don't understand what you mean.

original: Un chat enmouflé ne prend point de souris.
translated: A cat wearing gloves won't catch any mice.
